creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text:
If you have an app which raises a run time exception then when fork=false this 
always results in a build exception being thrown, regardless of the 
failonerror flag; when fork=true the handling is (correctly) dependent upon 
the FOE flag setting: continue when false, fail when true.

test case checked in to the (excluded) JavaTest class

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Fixed in nightly build 2002-04-09 - JavaTest passes for me now.

Can we enable it, Steve?
